intro: Sphaerostephanos subcordatus, commonly known as the broad-leaved stephanos, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, clustered inflorescences. The plant features lanceolate to ovate leaves with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Its flowers are typically tubular with two lips, and they come in shades of violet or purple. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or riverine habitats.
